function.name: SZAAngle
function.syntax: double SZAAngle(double lon,double lat,double dec,double Hangle);

description.p: The SZAAngle function calculates the Solar-Zenith Angle at a given location and time.
The geographic position of the point to calculate the angle for is given by the arguments lon and lat. The solar declination angle and the solar hour angle are given by the arguments dec and Hangle.

function.returns: Returns the Solar-Zenith Angle in degrees.

function.name: SZAEqOfTime

description.p: The SZAEqOfTime function calculates the Equation of Time for a given longitude and year.
The mean solar longitude is given by the argument lon and the year by the argument yr.

function.returns: Returns the calculated value for the Equation of Time.

description.p: The SZASolarLoc function calculates the location of the sun.
The year is given by the argument yr and the time by the argument t1 expressed as seconds from the start of the year.
The calculated mean solar longitude and declination are stored at the locations pointed to by the arguments lon and dec.
